learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate, critically review, and synthesise the literature and knowledge base in the field of study
Design and implement a research project with the guidance of a supervisor
Use research methodologies to extend and redefine existing knowledge or professional practice
Communicate the results of the study effectively through the preparation and submission of the written thesis
Disseminate and promote new insights to peers and the community
Design, conduct, and report research in a manner consistent with relevant ethical guidelines

assessments.due_date: The dissertation is due for submission in the 6th semester of consecutive enrolment
assessments.task_description:
The Dissertation counts for half of the course (32 out of 64 units). The dissertation should be of sufficient depth and scope to reflect the research skills that are described by the Australian Qualification Framework as being necessary for a program at a Level 10 Doctoral Degree.  The dissertation can take the form of a traditional research-only thesis, or it can be in the form of a substantial paper or series of papers (ready for submission or submitted), with a general Introduction and a unifying Discussion.  The form of the dissertation should be discussed and agreed with the supervisor.

The usual minimum length of the dissertation is 30,000 words and the maximum length should not exceed 50,000 words, excluding Tables, Figures, References, and Appendices. The writing must conform to the most current American Psychological Association style requirements.

The dissertation will be submitted when enrolled in PSYC8005/PSYC8010 Dissertation and is the formal assessment of 6 semesters of enrolment in the dissertation courses and should demonstrate the reporting of a substantial piece of original research that has been conducted by the candidate for the prescribed period under proper academic supervision in a research environment. By the end of the DP candidature, the candidate should be capable of independently conceiving, designing, carrying out and reporting a major research project.

Further information on the Dissertation courses including dissertation preparation and submission requirements can be found on the Blackboard Community [Doctor of Psychology Dissertation] website.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: The confirmation milestone must be completed by the last day of teaching (Wk 13) in the semester.
assessments.task_description:
The Confirmation Milestone is undertaken in Semester 2 of Year 2 of standard enrolment in the Dissertation course.  It consists of the following:

1) preparation of a 10 pp. (excluding references and appendices) document, uploaded into the Turnitin Folder of the Blackboard  Community website [Doctor of Psychology Dissertation].

2) a 20-minute presentation of your research plan and progress to date, with 10 minutes for questions, followed by a 30-minute interview with the course coordinator, supervisor and reader. 

The confirmation document will have two readers: the Course Coordinator and a second reader who will be approached by the supervisor for his/her agreement to review the document and their name provided with the confirmation document when it is submitted.  The confirmation document will need to be uploaded 2 weeks before the scheduled interview times to allow the coordinator and readers time to review. 

After completing the different components of the milestone process, a report will be sent by the Course Coordinator to the supervisor for signature by him/her and the student.  The completed report is to be uploaded by the student through Turnitin in the Assessment Folder on the Blackboard site and the Course Coordinator will approve the form AFTER uploading.

assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: The mid-dissert milestone must be completed by the last day of teaching (wk 13) in the semester.
assessments.task_description:
The mid-dissertation review is undertaken in Semester 2 of Year 3 of standard enrolment in the Dissertation course.  There are three components to the mid-dissertation review:
• written work;
• a brief report summarising progress against the timeline agreed to at confirmation, and set of goals and plan of work for the period leading up to dissertation review; and
• an interview.

The specific requirements for the written work will vary on a case by case basis, depending on the nature of the project.  Each student should negotiate the requirements with the advisory team and the Course Coordinator (if further advice is needed).  For example, the written work might take the form of a systematic literature review, study protocol, methods section, data analytic strategy, or a draft manuscript for publication.  Whatever the precise form of the written work it must demonstrate production of work at a level consistent with that expected of a Level 10 degree, including demonstrated knowledge of relevant background research, critical analysis of evidence, and clear exposition of research conducted by the student. 

The panel will assess whether:
• Satisfactory progress has been made since confirmation;
• The project remains suitable for a Level 10 dissertation;
• The student is capable of completing DPsych level work;
• The dissertation promises to be completed within the expected period of enrolment within existing resources;
• There are any factors delaying progress; and
• The advisory relationship is adequate and effective.
This assessment will be made on the basis of the written work and the interview

After completing the different components of the milestone process, a report will be sent by the Course Coordinator to the supervisor and student for their signatures.  The completed report is to be uploaded by the student to Turnitin in the Assessment Folder on the Blackboard site and the Course Coordinator will approve the form AFTER uploading.

learning_activities.topic:
Dissertation

The candidate will design and plan the research and its timelines, and undertake the research with the guidance of a supervisor, in consideration of the timing of the relevant milestone and submission
